lexUnit.name: vacate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: leave (a place) in which one has lived, or spent a long period of time.

sentence.text: Vacating the City to recuperate at a weekend retreat is nothing new .
City officials will order the Palais de la Civilisation to vacate its home of seven years to make room for Quebec 's first gambling casino .
Outside the breeding season birds vacate the ledges to wander the oceans .
Guests will be required to vacate their rooms by 11 a.m. , noon at the latest , to enable the housekeeping staff to service and clean rooms for the next group .
You are requested to vacate your tables by 2.00 p.m. and 5.00 p.m. respectively .
Diners are requested to vacate their tables by 8.15 p.m. and 10.45 p.m. respectively .
He has acquired the Cork Street premises vacated three years ago by Bernard Jacobson .
And we have to vacate this room in three months ' time because of the restoration work and the collection must be catalogued by then .
Boris Gromov , had agreed that CIS armed forces would vacate Chechnia on a " mutual security basis " .
You will be required to vacate the land on six months notice expiring at the end of any month .
After ten years in partnership , Nik Powell vacated his office at Virgin in less than twenty-four hours , and Richard Branson was on his own .
Lord McAlpine ended his tenancy in May , vacating the house before a two-day auction of his possessions at Sotheby 's .
Clerical staff at Oxford Polytechnic vacated their desks for the picket line .
There was no fire , and all four occupants quickly vacated the wreckage with no more than minor injuries .
Hekmatyar threatened to " mount the last act " if the Uzbeks did not vacate Kabul within a week to 10 days .
The staff turn all lights off as they vacate the building . "
Just say the word and I 'll vacate the office . "
Many old farmhouses were , of course , sometimes divided into two or three cottages once their gentry or yeomen owners had vacated them .
There was a smell of coffee in the air and a feeling that every room had only just been vacated by somebody .
The far bank was not going to be vacated by the enemy without a struggle .
The hovel in which they had lived was vacated in 1930 .
Agreeing to the deal , I will vacate my pad every Monday evening and every third Sunday .
He will thus vacate possibly the most influential post in English domestic cricket when the game is at a watershed .
One lunchtime Barry and Diane were sacked , and told that they and their three children had to vacate their living quarters there and then .
Despite such setbacks to the normalisation policy , the RUC has continued to fulfil the security role vacated by the Army .
The very sick had been wheeled into spaces vacated by simple fracture and tonsillectomies .
Mr Gough is now sitting in the European chair vacated by John Bullock who retired in October last year .
Sprague Electric , which vacated in 1985 , will donate the abandoned complex if state funds are secured .
The house was not vacated for several months .
If , then , the Member is still of unsound mind , his seat is automatically vacated .
I 'm awfully sorry , but in the morning we have to vacate . "
He sank into the chair his mother had recently vacated .
He flicked two inches of ash on the floor and sat down on the edge of the bed I had just vacated .
Immediately fire drills were followed and the building vacated .
